0.points:
What Philosophy Is

  • Philosophy is all of rational inquiry except for science.
  • Philosophy deals with metaphysics, epistemology, and ethics.
  • Metaphysics is concerned with the nature of reality.
  • Epistemology is concerned with the nature of knowledge and justified belief.
  • Ethics is concerned with what we ought to do and how we ought to live.
0.script:
1.

What Philosophy Is

  • Philosophy is all of rational inquiry except for science.
  • Philosophy deals with metaphysics, epistemology, and ethics.
  • Metaphysics is concerned with the nature of reality.
  • Epistemology is concerned with the nature of knowledge and justified belief.
  • Ethics is concerned with what we ought to do and how we ought to live.

1.points:
Metaphysics

  • Metaphysics deals with the nature of reality.
  • Metaphysical questions include the existence of God and the nature of free will.
  • Contemporary metaphysics aims to understand how claims about reality logically hang together or conflict.
  • Metaphysics explores the realm of possibility and necessity.
1.script:
2.

Metaphysics

  • Metaphysics deals with the nature of reality.
  • Metaphysical questions include the existence of God and the nature of free will.
  • Contemporary metaphysics aims to understand how claims about reality logically hang together or conflict.
  • Metaphysics explores the realm of possibility and necessity.

2.points:
Epistemology

  • Epistemology deals with the nature of knowledge and justified belief.
  • Questions include what is knowledge and can we have any knowledge at all.
  • Skepticism denies that we can have any knowledge whatsoever.
  • Questions of rational justification and what we ought to believe are relevant.
2.script:
3.

Epistemology

  • Epistemology deals with the nature of knowledge and justified belief.
  • Questions include what is knowledge and can we have any knowledge at all.
  • Skepticism denies that we can have any knowledge whatsoever.
  • Questions of rational justification and what we ought to believe are relevant.

3.points:
Ethics

  • Ethics deals with what we ought to do, how we ought to live, and how we ought to organize our communities.
  • Philosophy takes seriously the possibility of rational inquiry into ethical matters.
  • Ethics involves exploring questions about the value of love, morality, and our treatment of others.
3.script:
4.

Ethics

  • Ethics deals with what we ought to do, how we ought to live, and how we ought to organize our communities.
  • Philosophy takes seriously the possibility of rational inquiry into ethical matters.
  • Ethics involves exploring questions about the value of love, morality, and our treatment of others.

4.points:
The Value of Philosophy

  • Philosophy aims at knowledge and understanding, but often fails to establish definitive answers.
  • Philosophy reveals why some initial answers to big philosophical questions are problematic.
  • Philosophy liberates us from narrow-minded thinking and opens our minds to new possibilities.
  • Philosophy removes the certainty of our opinions and increases our knowledge of possibilities.
  • Choosing liberty and open inquiry over clinging to comforting opinions.
4.script:
5.

The Value of Philosophy

  • Philosophy aims at knowledge and understanding, but often fails to establish definitive answers.
  • Philosophy reveals why some initial answers to big philosophical questions are problematic.
  • Philosophy liberates us from narrow-minded thinking and opens our minds to new possibilities.
  • Philosophy removes the certainty of our opinions and increases our knowledge of possibilities.
  • Choosing liberty and open inquiry over clinging to comforting opinions.
